alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 11:31PM MST until September 01 at 7:30AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 730 AM MST Friday. * At 1129 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott, Hillside, Hawkins, Yava, Piedmont, Yarnell, Congress, Skull Valley, Escapees North Ranch, McLendon Peak, Wilhoit, Tres Alamos Wilderness, Bagdad, Bagdad Airport and Wickenburg Ranch. This includes the following swimming holes... Wolf Creek Falls. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 149 and 196. State Route 89 between mile markers 258 and 309. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
